dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You know, I was stuck in Astana traffic for like, forty minutes this morning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know, I was stuck in Astana traffic for like, forty minutes this morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh man, that's brutal. And speaking of that, the city's Akimat is actually trying to tackle that exact issue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh man, that's brutal. And speaking of that, the city's Akimat is actually trying to tackle that exact issue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan's Ministry of Labor and Social Protection has commented on the Akimat (local government administration) of Astana's recent proposal to revise the work schedule for certain organizations in the city. On Monday, Astana akim (governor) Zhenis Kassymbek announced that the city is considering adjusting work hours for specific sectors in an effort to ease traffic congestion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Zhenis Kassymbek, the governor, just announced they're looking at shifting work hours for some sectors to ease congestion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Zhenis Kassymbek, the governor, just announced they're looking at shifting work hours for some sectors to ease congestion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Monday, Astana akim (governor) Zhenis Kassymbek announced that the city is considering adjusting work hours for specific sectors in an effort to ease traffic congestion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he mentioned starting government agencies at 8:30 a.m. instead of the usual time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he mentioned starting government agencies at eight thirty a.m. instead of the usual time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He noted that one of the proposals involves starting the workday at 08:30 a.m. for government agencies, budget-funded institutions, and municipal services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the Ministry of Labor actually did a study on this—they found no negative impacts from shifting schedules.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Ministry of Labor actually did a study on this-they found no negative impacts from shifting schedules.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Ministry of Labor participated in a study on whether shifting the work schedule would have negative effects. No adverse impacts were found, Abulhatin stated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's interesting. So it's not just a random idea; they've looked into it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's interesting. So it's not just a random idea; they've looked into it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Yerbolat Abulhatin from the Ministry emphasized that local bodies can set their own hours based on regional needs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Yerbolat Abulhatin from the Ministry emphasized that local bodies can set their own hours based on regional needs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yerbolat Abulhatin, Chairman of the Committee for State Labor Inspection at the Ministry of Labor and Social Protection, responded to the proposal. He emphasized that local executive bodies are permitted to set their own work schedules based on regional needs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense—I think East Kazakhstan already does something similar, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense-I think East Kazakhstan already does something similar, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, in the East Kazakhstan region and other areas, different schedules have already been adopted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they've adopted different schedules there. The key is sticking to the eight-hour day and 40-hour week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they've adopted different schedules there. The key is sticking to the eight-hour day and forty-hour week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What matters most is compliance with the Labor Code, maintaining the standard eight-hour workday and a 40-hour workweek.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So it's flexible but within the legal framework. Do we know when this might happen?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's flexible but within the legal framework. Do we know when this might happen?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They're aiming for August if it gets approved. Seems pretty soon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're aiming for August if it gets approved. Seems pretty soon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If approved, the changes could be implemented as early as August.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I wonder how employees feel about potentially starting earlier though.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I wonder how employees feel about potentially starting earlier though.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, but if it cuts down on commute time, it might be worth it for a lot of people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but if it cuts down on commute time, it might be worth it for a lot of people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that morning gridlock is no joke. Let's see if other cities follow suit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that morning gridlock is no joke. Let's see if other cities follow suit.
